article.title: Lockheed Martin Provides EO/IR Countermeasures
article.text: Lockheed Martin Aculight Corp., Bothell, Washington, is being awarded a $10,608,799 cost-plus-fixed-fee completion contract for work associated with the multispectral electro-optic infrared (EO/IR) countermeasures for advanced threats function of the combined EO/IR surveillance and response system program. The total cumulative value of this contract is $10,608,799. The contract will be incrementally funded. Work will be performed in Bothell, Washington, and is expected to be completed March 1, 2020. Fiscal 2016 research, development, test and evaluation (Navy) funds in the amount of $10,000 will be obligated at the time of award. No funds will expire at the end of the current fiscal year. The contract was competitively procured under request for proposal N00173-15-R-SE04, for which five offers were received. The Naval Research Laboratory, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity (N00173-16-C-6010).
